channel.title: The switch Statement :: Data Structures in C#
channel.description: The switch Statement The switch statement provides an alternative to the if statement for certain contexts. It is used when different cases must be handled based on the value of an expression that can have only a few possible results. For example, suppose we want to display a MessageBox containing “Abort”, “Retry”, and “Ignore” buttons. The user can respond in only three ways, and we need different code in each case.
